author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Hello, I am an automated registration bot. I help manage the registration process by checking your registration against a set of [AutoMerge guidelines](https://juliaregistries.github.io/RegistryCI.jl/stable/guidelines/). If all these guidelines are met, this pull request will be merged automatically, completing your registration. It is **strongly recommended** to follow the guidelines, since otherwise the pull request needs to be manually reviewed and merged by a human.

## 1. New package registration

Please make sure that you have read the [package naming guidelines](https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/dev/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines-1).

## 2. [AutoMerge Guidelines](https://juliaregistries.github.io/RegistryCI.jl/stable/guidelines/) are all met! ✅

Your new package registration met all of the guidelines for auto-merging and is scheduled to be merged when the mandatory waiting period (3 days) has elapsed.

## 3. To pause or stop registration

If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment.

_Tip: You can edit blocking comments to add `[noblock]` in order to unblock auto-merging._

<!-- [noblock] -->
<!---
this_is_the_single_automerge_comment
--->
See https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/pull/138333#issuecomment-3279938525: could this potentially be moved to the JuliaSparse organization?

@goerz, that makes total sense. Do you think it’s better to wait for the merge before requesting the move, or should I go ahead and request it now?

[noblock]
Definitely move _before_ you register: changing the repo for a registered package is a pain (requires manual intervention by a full registry maintainer)

Ok! @goerz, do you know who I can reach out to for assistance with the transfer since I'm not a member of JuliaSparse?

[noblock]

I've pinged the `#linear-algebra` channel on [Slack](https://julialang.org/slack/) to see if there's an org owner around who can help with this.

Alternatively, it could make sense to make a [(pre-)announcement](https://discourse.julialang.org/c/package-announcements/60) on [Discourse](https://discourse.julialang.org).

Those are the two primary channels to engage with the community

https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/pull/138333#issuecomment-3280628838

>> I think I would like the old name better (or maybe in the capitalization MultiDimensionalSparseArrays), but I suppose that's just a matter of taste, so: up to you.
>
> Thanks for the feedback, @goerz! I’ve updated the package name to NDimensionalSparseArrays to better align with the exported struct NDSparseArray.

That makes sense, although strictly speaking, the guideline for pluralized package names doesn't _exactly_ apply here: that would be "`NDSparseArrays` provides the `NDSparseArray` struct" (but I think `NDSparseArrays` would not be a great package name). So as far as I'm concerned, this still could go either way. I don't have a very strong opinion on this, but maybe people in the JuliaSparse org can chime in with what they think is best

[noblock]

@raphasampaio Can you transfer the repo to me? I will then transfer the repo to JuliaSparse, and then I will restore your admin permissions on the repo.

[noblock]

I'll defer to the more active linear algebra folks regarding the name. @raphasampaio Are you in the JuliaLang Slack?

> @raphasampaio Can you transfer the repo to me? I will then transfer the repo to JuliaSparse, and then I will restore your admin permissions on the repo.

Sure!

> I'll defer to the more active linear algebra folks regarding the name. @raphasampaio Are you in the JuliaLang Slack?

Yes, I am there
@goerz, I think we can now close this PR due to https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/pull/138375
Closing in favor of #138375, per discussion above.

body:

<!--  -->
title: New package: NDimensionalSparseArrays v0.1.0
